page.title: 04OUNDLE AS A SHOPPING CENTRE
page.content: Oundle has quite a few small shops.In fact for a town of its size it is well served.Many of the shops are family businesses.There are no multiple chain stores here.The range of shops is very good.Local residents can buy clothes, food,newspapers or a television. The town has an exceptional bookshop,which is owned by the public school.There is also a large music shop,which is unusual in a town of this size. These shops are used by the local residents and by the many nearby villages,most of which have no shops at all.Oundle grew up as a market town.A small but popular market still takes place each Thursday,but there is no cattle market.This takes place in Thrapston.Despite the scope offered by the local shops however many go to the bigger towns.The Queensgate Centre in Peterborough is popular.
